intro: Poraqueiba sericea, commonly known as the silky poraqueiba, is a shrub native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has a smooth, silvery appearance due to its fine, silky hairs covering the leaves and stems. It is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds in its native environment.
